name: Kirby Dick

roles_in_work.title: Sick: the life and death of Bob Flanagan, supermasochist (D)
Sick: the life and death of Bob Flanagan, supermasochist (D)
Private practices: the story of a sex surrogate

biography: Kirby Bryan Dick (born August 23, 1952) is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, and editor best known for directing documentary films. He received Academy Award nominations for Best Documentary Feature for directing Twist of Faith (2005) and The Invisible War (2012). He has also received numerous awards from film festivals, including the Sundance Film Festival and Los Angeles Film Festival.
